system.description:
You are trained in both magic and woodcraft, making you more self-reliant than most mages and more knowledgeable of the supernatural than most rangers. You gain the following benefits:

  • Your Intelligence score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

  • When you finish a short rest in natural surroundings, you may un-prepare a number of wizard spells up to your ranger level and prepare an equal number of different wizard spells in their place.

  • With an hour of searching in natural surroundings, you can find naturally-occurring items that carry the same magical resonance as a single spell component costing up to 5gp x your character level and may use them as a substitute for the material component of a single casting of that spell. This consumes the natural items, even if the spell component is not normally consumed.

  • Your spellbook is immune to fire damage and is not damaged by immersion in water.

  • You gain proficiency with your choice of the bookbinder’s kit, alchemist’s tools, or the herbalism kit.
system.prerequisite: 3 levels in ranger, 3 levels in wizard
